channel.title: [PI] [Paying RSGP] Cache
channel.description:
I have a problem with my cache. It's 95MB and downloads at 28 KB/s the second time I tried auto downloading it. The first time I tried auto downloading it, it downloaded at more than 1k KB/s. I tried a different source and this exact same thing happened. The first time, it worked, the second time, it didn't.
Paying 2M RSGP to whoever helps me fix it.
[img]http://www.imgjoe.com/x/cacheoqo.png[/img]

item.title: [PI] [Paying RSGP] Cache
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Nonamee, post:13, topic:413646”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=515180.msg3741012#msg3741012 date=1315347703]

Pack the models into the cache, so it doesn’t have to hold 60Mb, and loads much quicker.

:o Dunno how lawl.

Use the JAGGRAB implementation. They don’t have to download the cache, and it’s how the client was meant to be.
[/quote]

I heard that used for 508+ servers. Mine is a 317. Idk if it even matters, either way, idk what you mean haha.[/quote]

There’s a JAGGRAB implementation for the 317. Hyperion has it.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] [Paying RSGP] Cache
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

iiLovePVP:

ermm download it manually and place it in your C: drive?

I don’t like that idea. It’s annoying for each player have to download the client then the cache and then extract it to the C: drive. Some are absolutely retarded and wouldn’t have a clue of what to do.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] [Paying RSGP] Cache
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

The first time I downloaded it, it downloaded at more than 1000KB/s. I had this exact same problem on another source’s client too. It downloaded fast the first time and then really slow.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Either way, not a problem with the client.

item.title: [PI] [Paying RSGP] Cache
item.dc:creator: @C_Imbued C++ Imbued
item.description:
@C_Imbued wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:4, topic:413646”][quote author=Nonamee link=topic=515180.msg3740336#msg3740336 date=1315274956]

I have a problem with my cache. It’s 95MB and downloads at 28 KB/s the second time I tried auto downloading it. The first time I tried auto downloading it, it downloaded at more than 1k KB/s. I tried a different source and this exact same thing happened. The first time, it worked, the second time, it didn’t.

Paying 2M RSGP to whoever helps me fix it.

What exactly is the problem?

It downloads wayyyy too slowly. (28KB/s)
[/quote]

That’s your internet connection. It has nothing to do with the client. You might be able to optimize it slightly to get 30Kb, but I doubt it.[/quote]Could also be his webhost /:

Read full topic

Paying 2M RSGP to whoever helps me fix it.

[/quote]

It downloads wayyyy too slowly. (28KB/s)[/quote]

That’s your internet connection. It has nothing to do with the client. You might be able to optimize it slightly to get 30Kb, but I doubt it.
